aws::graph::propositions: # Amazon's Use of Third-Party Technology and Security Measures
Amazon uses third-party technology and systems for encryption and authentication technology.
Amazon uses third-party technology and systems for employee email.
Amazon uses third-party technology and systems for content delivery to customers.
Amazon uses third-party technology and systems for back-office support.
Amazon uses third-party technology and systems for other functions.
Some of Amazon's systems have experienced past security incidents.
Past security incidents did not have a material adverse effect on Amazon's operating results.
There is no assurance that future security incidents will not have material adverse effects on Amazon's operations.
There is no assurance that future security incidents will not have material adverse effects on Amazon's financial results.
Amazon has developed systems designed to protect customer data.
Amazon has developed processes designed to protect customer data.
Amazon has developed systems designed to prevent security incidents.
Amazon has developed systems designed to detect security incidents.
Amazon has developed systems designed to mitigate security incidents.
Amazon has developed processes designed to prevent security incidents.
Amazon has developed processes designed to detect security incidents.
Amazon has developed processes designed to mitigate security incidents.
Amazon has developed systems designed to reduce the impact of a security incident at a third-party vendor.
Amazon has developed systems designed to reduce the impact of a security incident at a customer.
Amazon's security measures cannot provide absolute security.
Amazon's security measures may fail to operate as intended.
Amazon's security measures may be circumvented.

text: We use third-party technology and systems for a variety of reasons, including, without limitation, encryption and authentication technology, employee email, content delivery to customers, back-office support, and other functions. Some of our systems have experienced past security incidents, and, although they did not have a material adverse effect on our operating results, there can be no assurance that future incidents will not have material adverse effects on our operations or financial results. Although we have developed systems and processes that are designed to protect customer data and prevent, detect, or mitigate such incidents, including systems and processes designed to reduce the impact of a security incident at a third-party vendor or customer, such measures cannot provide absolute security and may fail to operate as intended or be circumvented.
